body: awesome find, please supply with a CSB. I will investigate into the fix.
I couldn't reproduce this issue: https://codesandbox.io/s/sparkling-smoke-1q6w6 can you please provide example.
wait, i am going to try it out firefox now.

The error happens when the unset function is called. Is it being called? In my app it is called when the component is unmounted. 
I’ll try to provide an example today.
yes, please and yes it's been invoked. We still need to find a way to reproduce the issue and fix it accordingly.
I forgot to say that the input is nested. So maybe setting the name to something like “files.image”

> yes, please and yes it's been invoked. We still need to find a way to reproduce the issue and fix it accordingly.

More differences from the codebox you provided: you are only removing the input field. In my case the whole component is being removed, including the <form> tag. Maybe making a FormComponent with a file input “name=files.name” and then removing it. 

Also don’t forget to add a file to the input and use Firefox

> Also don’t forget to add a file to the input and use Firefox

Did that as well.

> tag. Maybe making a FormComponent with a file input “name=files.name” and then removing it.

try above as well: https://codesandbox.io/s/infallible-kapitsa-wrm9v
btw I do believe the issue exists, just need to find a way to reproduce this issue. :)

Well, I picked your CSB and added modified the input name from "test" to "file.test" and it instantly produced the error, so it may be related to nested inputs.

aha cool. yeah that must be it. thanks

Yes, I think it is only when using nested inputs. Did you manage to replicate the error?

I modified the input name, added a file, and clicked remove.
yea i did, it's only to do with nested inputs. I will patch that soon.  (only in FF as well)
patched: https://codesandbox.io/s/epic-microservice-o6i7d if you can verify, i will merge the fix.
